admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Inplementation Completion
            Report( ICR) for the Vocational Training (Electricity)
            Project in the Arab Republic of Egypt. The Vocational
            Training( Electricity) project was initiated as a response
            to the Government's decision to address severe
            shortages of skilled manpower in the electrical power
            sector, through manpower planning and recruitment of an
            adequate number of well trained staff. The main objectives
            of the  project weret o alleviate the shortage of trained
            manpower in the sector, and to develop a training capability
            within the Ministry of Electricity and     Energy (MOEE) to
            upgrade the skills of its engineers, technicians and skilled
            craftsmen each year. equipped. The successful completion of
            technical assistance activities was one of the most positive
            outcomes of the project. The project has had a good impact
            on training and manpower development. The Bank performed
            satisfactorily through all the phases of the project. One
            important lesson learned in this project is the flexibility
            in project design and Bank agreement to amend the loan to
            facilitate evolving needs of the sector and the
            beneficiaries needed to the successful implementation of
            project objectives. Under its training plan (ongoing through
            1998), the Egypt Electricity Authority (EEA) wants to
            establish new centers in the northern parts of Upper Egypt
            and in the West Delta. Establishment of a Senior Management
            Training Center for the MOEE is also envisaged as well as
            development of existing centers to include additional and
            specialized workshops.
